intro: Galium cilicicum, commonly known as Cilician bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender stems that are often hairy and grows in rocky or sandy soils. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from spring to summer. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
